particleSystem
Class Particle

java.lang.Object
  particleSystem.Particle

public class Particle
extends java.lang.Object

The Particles
There are different kind of particles. Simple ones and complexer ones.
check the different constructors. all the fields can be set later during runtimme
based on: Daniel Shiffman's Nature of Code

Version:
0.96
Author:
fabiantheblind

the gravity of the particle.
it mostly affects the emitter particles
ore when the particles have no path to follow

radius

private float radius
the radius of the particle.
the particle has no ellipse right now but this is still needed for collision

See Also:
display()

lifeTime

private float lifeTime
the time a particle lifes.
We set it realy high so they dont disapper. It is usefull if you wan't to use the emitter in the particlesystem

See Also:
ParticleSystem Class, ParticleSystem.addParticleEmitter(boolean), ParticleSystem.setEmitterOrigin(PVector), run(), update(), getALife()

mass

private float mass
The higher the mass of an particle the lesser the particles get pushed by Repeller
may never be real 0 i think (or at startup) set it to 0.00000001f

See Also:
Repeller.pushParticle(Particle)

affection

private boolean affection
to check if an particle should get affected by the repellers or not

hidden

private boolean hidden
if this is true the particle will not be drawn to the screen
and the other particles dont steer around them

See Also:
it happens in TMNUelaerm.draw()

pathNum

private int pathNum
the number of the path to follow. This is specially if you have more than one path. so the particle can switch between paths

origin

private final processing.core.PVector origin
the particle knows where he originated.
this is for the paths points They are also particles

Constructor Detail

Particle

public Particle(processing.core.PApplet p,
                processing.core.PVector loc,
                processing.core.PVector vel,
                float r,
                float ms,
                float mf,
                int pathNum,
                boolean affection,
                boolean hidden)
This is the Master Constructor. you can also set all these parameters at runtime

Parameters:
p - the PApplet
loc - the location
vel - the velocity
r - the radius
ms - the maxspeed
mf - the maxforce
numOfPaths - the path to follow
affection - should it get affected or not
hidden - is it a hidden particle (see Path)

setLifeTime

public void setLifeTime(float lifeTimeIn)
set the lifetime of the particle
if u want to use this you need to add this.lifeTime -= 0.5; to update()
or add getALife(); to run()

Parameters:
lifeTimeIn - give him a float like 100 Frames or so
See Also:
lifeTime, update(), getALife(), ParticleSystem.addParticleEmitter(boolean), ParticleSystem.setEmitterOrigin(PVector)
